item.title: Miniconda on Windows 10
item.description: I’m at Pycon 2018. It’s been lovely; the keynotes, the dinners, the talks, the people — all of it. The development sprints are a part of conference I am particularly interested in, and the organisers created a helpful workshop to help prepare folks. Part of this is installing Anaconda as a way of driving virtual environments. It’s a good plan, and even though Visual Studio Express installs one for you already, I decided to be strict about all this and download it from here, as directed.
